result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property - Exception is contact only for couples counseling with a licensed counselor.
Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements - soberlink

12:02 PM Defendant Kevin George Anderson appeared by zoom audio.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by video for Kevin George Anderson.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Bill Meyer informs the Court that he made a formal record  requesting of medical rpts and still needs that material and also needs an offer in this case. Defense to file that request so it's in the case. 12:06 PM DA Urmanski know on zoom. Victim has questions but DA Urmanski asks victim to reach out to victim witness/could get an atty free of charge. Victim requests no contact restriction be removed from bond. DA Urmanski states standard ERD completed 4.26.22. DA Urmanski informs the Court of deft's past criminal history and has no objection to no violent or abusive contact and w/soberlink. Deft makes a statement to the Court that he completed both programs (Stepping Stones and Samaritan's Hand). Court would like proof of programs. Victim addresses the Court again. Discussion on self rpt and level of intoxication of both the deft and victim. Court amends bond conditions and contact only for couples counseling with a licensed counselor and adds soberlink.

3:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Grant D Scaife in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin George Anderson appeared by phone.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by video for Kevin George Anderson. Defense bond motion request to return to apartment-victim is no longer residing there.  State filed a letter on behalf of victim-ERD completed. Victim is present via zoom.  Requesting no violent or abusive contact. Court removes residence restriction as long as the victim is not there. If the victim returns bond will revert back to no contact with the residence on north 12th street. State objects to modifying contact condition. Victim makes statement. Court denies contact between the deft and victim.

1:09 PM Defendant Kevin George Anderson in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.Both parties appeared via zoom. Defendant Kevin George Anderson in custody at SCDC. Grant D Scaife appeared in person for the Wisconsin, State of.
Deft. waives right to appear in person for todays hearing. Preliminary hearing questionnaire & waiver filed. Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information E-filed/reading waived by Attorney Mayer, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim present & makes a statement to the Court.
State objects to the motion to modify bond. Defense reviews request to modify bond. Court takes motion to modify bond (cash amount) under advisement at this time.
Attorney Mayer to contact JA for future Court dates.
